creator: madhu_nalla@satyam.com
text:
We are facing a very strange problem in out Web Application. The conf for out 
production environment is :

Web Server	:	Apache Web Server 1.3.24
Servlet Runner	:	Apache Tomcat 3.2.3
Operating Sys	:	Win2k Advance Server

We are using Jdk1.3.0. Now the problem is like this.

We have few web-pages in our application. Each page has one unique request id 
associated. Depending Upon the request id in user request we generate the 
output web page. Some of our web-pages are continuously refreshed every 1-
minute.

Now suppose I am at a page with request id 1 (which is refreshed automatically) 
and some other user is at some other auto-refreshing page with some other 
request id.
If I leave the web-page open for some time then either I will get redirected to 
some other page or I get some error page. After thorough analysis of the 
problem I came to
know that this is the problem with http session. The request id for one user 
session is taken by the another user session which further cause these errors. 
Do we need to do some configuration for maintaining proper sessions in Apache. 

Please give a early reply as we are facing this problem on our production site.

Thanks

creator: madhu_nalla@satyam.com
text:
We did not get any reply for this bug till now. Please help us as we are facing 
this problem for a long time and are not able to find the cure. This problem is 
a show-stopper problem for us.

Thanks

Madhu

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Unless you are using mod_unique_id [totally broken until about 1.3.26] you
  are dealing with tomcat session state info.  Since you misfiled this bug,
  that is why you received no response.

  Presuming you ment to file this as a tomcat bug.

Hello Rowe,

The config in httpd.conf file are as given below. 
          #AddModule mod_unique_id.c
          AddModule mod_ntlm.c
          AddModule mod_jk.c
That means we are not using mod_unique_id. We still feel that the problem is 
with the web-server not maintaining proper HTTP sessions and the sessions are 
clashing. The content of one session is available to the other session. So is 
there any config setting which we need to change to have proper session 
handling in apache web server. Thanks for an early reply.

Naveen
creator: naveen_jaidayal@satyam.com
wrowe@apache.org
text:
This is probably addressed in the 3.3 releases and Apache 1.3.26, suggest
  you try upgrading to those.  I'm guessing this is a large cookies problem,
  and that mod_ntlm is possibly interacting with the headers/post body.

creator: sriramnrn@gmail.com
text: Please try your code with the latest stable version of Tomcat.

Tomcat 3 is no longer the focus of development.

It is almost certain there will be no development work on versions prior to 3.3.x and it is highly unlikely that further development will take place on 3.3.x

All open Tomcat 3 bugs are therefore being closed as WONTFIX.

If any of these issues is still a problem for you, please test the latest stable release of a supported version (http://wiki.apache.org/tomcat/TomcatVersions). If you still have the issue with the latest stable release of a supported version, please re-open this bug and change the version to the one you tested.
